question: Which of the following correctly defines “Mother-of-pearl”?
option1: An oyster which yields the pearl
option2: A special large sized pearl found in Japan
option3: A hard iridescent substance forming the inner layer of certain shells
option4: Female individuals of certain species of shelled mollusk
answer: A hard iridescent substance forming the inner layer of certain shells
explanation: Nacre also known as mother of pearl, is an organic-inorganic composite material produced by some mollusks as an inner shell layer; it is also what makes up the outer coating of pearls. It is strong, resilient, and iridescent.
